file_content.text: I will take those canisters to a quarantine zone to be destroyed.
These are all the canisters I was able to recover.
Thank you. The Republic thanks you.
Imagine how horrific it would be if this rakghoul nightmare had spread to the rest of the galaxy.
Please take this for your service.
Did you find anything, or have those vultures made off with the entire lot of Titroxinate already?
Excuse me, friends. I'm told you are among the Republic's most reliable operatives here.
Master Jedi! Please excuse my abruptness.
Excuse me. Lieutenant!
Excuse me, friend.
The Republic told me you might be able to help with a difficult situation. They say you are our most reliable operative on Taris.
Have you heard anything about Titroxinate being sold on the black market?
It's rare for Jedi to be consulted about the black market.
I don't know about criminals.
I suppose that's true. My apologies, Master Jedi.
What's the story?
I haven't heard anything.
I'm sure you know the history.
What makes you think I know anything about the black market? What are you implying?
Why would you ask that?
N--nothing. Only your reputation... I thought maybe you would... it doesn't matter.
What's "Titroxinate"?
Titroxinate?
Do you want something?
I just thought... you might be able to help us keep it out of the wrong hands.
Titroxinate was the pre-patent name for the weaponized agent we think was responsible for the rakghoul plague.
The Empire could fashion it into a terrible weapon--turning our soldiers into monsters and setting them against us.
Where's the arms dealer who's selling this stuff?
Who has the Titroxinate?
I'm more worried about his source.
So, how do I stop that?
We've traced the original Titroxinate samples to an old ChemWorks factory. It's overrun with nexu; we can't get near it.
If you can retrieve any canisters that remain, the Republic will see you're well rewarded for your effort.
I can't spend my time patrolling the galaxy for contraband.
I'm no cop. [Refuse quest]
Then you'd better hope you never end up on the receiving end of a blast of this.
My work here is classified.
